label: DesignUtils
comment:
Created Mar 8, 2010 by Andre Guirard/Cambridge/IBM
 	
Some functions useful in programmatically manipulating design elements.
commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Created Mar 8, 2010 by Andre Guirard/Cambridge/IBM<br /> 	<br />Some functions useful in programmatically manipulating design elements.</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
commenthtml: Created Mar 8, 2010 by Andre Guirard/Cambridge/IBM<br /> 	<br />Some functions useful in programmatically manipulating design elements.
inlinecomment:
' Created Mar 8, 2010 by Andre Guirard/Cambridge/IBM
 	
Some functions useful in programmatically manipulating design elements.

methods.label: Macroquote
methods.comment: Convert string to macro code quoted string; change all &quot; to \&quot; and add quotes at start and end.
methods.signature: Public Function Macroquote(x As String) As String
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Convert string to macro code quoted string; change all &quot; to \&quot; and add quotes at start and end.</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
methods.commenthtml: Convert string to macro code quoted string; change all &quot; to \&quot; and add quotes at start and end.
methods.inlinecomment: ' Convert string to macro code quoted string; change all &quot; to \&quot; and add quotes at start and end.

arguments.label: x
arguments.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>String to be converted. </pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>

methods.label: SetSelection
methods.comment:
Given the name of a design element type, e.g. &quot;Form&quot;, and a note collection, sets the note collection to select design elements of that type.
		
Note: detecting certain design elements requires testing $Flags. 
	
This means it doesn&apos;t always work to call SetSelection twice with the same collection but different design element names. 
		
For instance, if you say you want forms and file resources, you will find no forms because their $Flag items never contain the character &apos;g&apos;. Instead do two searches and combine results.
methods.signature: Public Sub SetSelection(ncol As NotesNoteCollection, strDesignType As String)
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Given the name of a design element type, e.g. &quot;Form&quot;, and a note collection, sets the note collection to select design elements of that type.<br />		<br />Note: detecting certain design elements requires testing $Flags. <br />	<br />This means it doesn&apos;t always work to call SetSelection twice with the same collection but different design element names. <br />		<br />For instance, if you say you want forms and file resources, you will find no forms because their $Flag items never contain the character &apos;g&apos;. Instead do two searches and combine results.</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
methods.commenthtml: Given the name of a design element type, e.g. &quot;Form&quot;, and a note collection, sets the note collection to select design elements of that type.<br />		<br />Note: detecting certain design elements requires testing $Flags. <br />	<br />This means it doesn&apos;t always work to call SetSelection twice with the same collection but different design element names. <br />		<br />For instance, if you say you want forms and file resources, you will find no forms because their $Flag items never contain the character &apos;g&apos;. Instead do two searches and combine results.
methods.inlinecomment:
' Given the name of a design element type, e.g. &quot;Form&quot;, and a note collection, sets the note collection to select design elements of that type.
		
Note: detecting certain design elements requires testing $Flags. 
	
This means it doesn&apos;t always work to call SetSelection twice with the same collection but different design element names. 
		
For instance, if you say you want forms and file resources, you will find no forms because their $Flag items never contain the character &apos;g&apos;. Instead do two searches and combine results.

arguments.label: ncol
arguments.comment: the collection to set selection for.
arguments.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>the collection to set selection for.</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
arguments.commenthtml: the collection to set selection for.
arguments.inlinecomment: ' the collection to set selection for.

arguments.label: strDesignType
arguments.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>the design element type, e.g. &quot;form&quot;, &quot;image&quot;.</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>

methods.label: SetSelectionExt
methods.argumentsuffix: (ncoll As NotesNoteCollection, strDesignType As String, addlCond As String, flags As Integer)
methods.signature: Public Sub SetSelectionExt(ncoll As NotesNoteCollection, strDesignType As String, addlCond As String, flags As Integer)
methods.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>Like SetSelection, this lets you set up a notesNoteCollection to search for design elements of a particular type, but it adds the ability to specify additional criteria to further narrow the selection.<br />		<br />This can be either in the form of a formula, or &quot;*&quot; followed by a design element title.<br />@see DesignUtils.SetSelection() </pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
methods.commenthtml: Like SetSelection, this lets you set up a notesNoteCollection to search for design elements of a particular type, but it adds the ability to specify additional criteria to further narrow the selection.<br />		<br />This can be either in the form of a formula, or &quot;*&quot; followed by a design element title.<br />@see DesignUtils.SetSelection()

arguments.label: ncoll
arguments.comment: the note collection whose selection criteria to set.
arguments.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>the note collection whose selection criteria to set.</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
arguments.commenthtml: the note collection whose selection criteria to set.
arguments.inlinecomment: ' the note collection whose selection criteria to set.

arguments.label: strDesignType
arguments.comment:
the type of design element you&apos;re looking for,
			e.g. &quot;xpage&quot; or &quot;view&quot;.
arguments.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>the type of design element you&apos;re looking for,<br />			e.g. &quot;xpage&quot; or &quot;view&quot;.</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
arguments.commenthtml: the type of design element you&apos;re looking for,<br />			e.g. &quot;xpage&quot; or &quot;view&quot;.
arguments.inlinecomment:
' the type of design element you&apos;re looking for,
			e.g. &quot;xpage&quot; or &quot;view&quot;.

arguments.label: addlCond
arguments.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>a formula that&apos;s &quot;anded&quot; with the selection formula<br />			for the design element type, to narrow down the design elements<br />			returned (e.g. {@Contains(&quot;$Flags&quot;; &quot;P&quot;)}) or &quot;*&quot; followed by a<br />			|-delimited list of design element names, e.g. &quot;*Reply|Report&quot;<br />			to search for design elements whose name or alias = &quot;Reply&quot; or &quot;Report&quot; </pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
arguments.commenthtml: a formula that&apos;s &quot;anded&quot; with the selection formula<br />			for the design element type, to narrow down the design elements<br />			returned (e.g. {@Contains(&quot;$Flags&quot;; &quot;P&quot;)}) or &quot;*&quot; followed by a<br />			|-delimited list of design element names, e.g. &quot;*Reply|Report&quot;<br />			to search for design elements whose name or alias = &quot;Reply&quot; or &quot;Report&quot;

arguments.label: flags
arguments.comment:
1 for case-insensitive match of design element names, else 0.
			Only has an effect when the &quot;*&quot; syntax of addlCond is used.
arguments.commentblock: <div class="description">	<ul class="blockList">		<li class="blockList">			<div class="comments"><!-- comment --><pre>1 for case-insensitive match of design element names, else 0.<br />			Only has an effect when the &quot;*&quot; syntax of addlCond is used.	</pre></div>			<hr />		</li>	</ul></div>
arguments.commenthtml: 1 for case-insensitive match of design element names, else 0.<br />			Only has an effect when the &quot;*&quot; syntax of addlCond is used.

			Only has an effect when the &quot;*&quot; syntax of addlCond is used.
